intro: Fibraurea laxa, commonly known as the slender fibraurea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of white to pale pink flowers, followed by small, berry-like fruits. Fibraurea laxa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
